translations: 沉默寡言的；无言的，不太说话的

sentences.sentence: He became a taciturn man, a man not easy to live with. Later, when the older children married and had children of their own, he mellowed a little.
sentences.translation: 他变成了一个沉默寡言的人、一个不容易相处的人。后来，等大点的孩子们结了婚，也有了他们自己的孩子，他变得平和了些。

sentences.sentence: The King chafed bitterly over the stupendous indignity thus put upon his royalty, but Hendon was moody and taciturn.
sentences.translation: 国王对他的王权受到的巨大侮辱感到非常愤怒，亨顿更是憋住一肚子气，沉默寡言。

sentences.sentence: Well before he died of cancer in 2008, Harold Pinter knew he had earned a reputation for being "enigmatic, taciturn, terse, prickly, explosive and forbidding".
sentences.translation: 早在2008年哈罗德·品特因癌症去世之前，他就知道了自己赢得了“高深莫测、沉默寡言、简洁、多刺、暴躁以及令人生畏”的名声。
